strapiPost.title: Crystal Bridges Opening Diego Rivera Exhibit This Weekend
strapiPost.photoCredit: Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art
strapiPost.content:
This Saturday, Mar 11, Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art will open its doors for Diego Rivera's America, the first major exhibition of the Mexican artist in over 20 years, featuring over 130 of his works.

  • Rivera's legacy: The exhibition showcases a broad range of Rivera's drawings, easel paintings, frescoes, and more, examining the social and cultural life of Mexico and America from the 1920s to the 1940s.
  • Unveiled: The collection includes rarely-seen works from private collections, contributions on loan from museums in the United States and Mexico, and three significant paintings by Frida Kahlo, including a self-portrait of her with Rivera. 

Read more about the exhibit and purchase tickets HERE.
